metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15117 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Synergy before version 1.12.0, a Synergy server can be crashed by receiving a kMsgHelloBack packet with a client name length set to 0xffffffff (4294967295) if the servers memory is less than 4 GB. It was verified that this issue does not cause a crash through the exception handler if the available memory of the Server is more than 4GB.

criterions.comment: synergy: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
